short_summary: Requests for Tug and Barge Services
description: Canadian Coast Guard requires tug and barge services to improve existing Aids to Navigation on the BC coast in the Southern Gulf Islands for users and maintenance. Work to be performed under this contract includes provision of tug, barge, and equipment services to assist the Canadian Coast Guard construction crews. Canadian Coast Guard will provide associated equipment and materials for barge mobilization to the AtoN sites. The project will mobilize from Victoria, BC to the BC coast staging locations. The project is scheduled in May and June of 2024.
full_summary:
### F1705-230968 - Tug and Barge Services for Aids to Navigation

#### Tender Announcement Detail

| Field | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Solicitation Number | WS4422483953 |
| Publication Date | April 12, 2024 |
| Tender Closing Date | May 3, 2024, 14:00:00 |
| Expect Contract Start Date | April 25, 2024 |
| Experience Type | Request for Proposal |
| Notice Type | Competitive - Open Bidding |
| Region | British Columbia |
| Contracting Entity | Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) |
| Contact Information | Sole, Mike |

#### Description of the Tender

The Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) is seeking contractor to provide two tug and barge services to improve the existing Aids to Navigation in the Southern Gulf Islands, British Columbia for users and maintenance. The contractor will be responsible for providing tug and barge services, including the equipment necessary for construction crews to perform their duties.

Canadian Coast Guard will provide associated equipment and materials for barge mobilization to the Aids to Navigation sites. The project will mobilize from Victoria, BC to the BC coast staging locations. The project is scheduled to be completed by June 2024.

#### Evaluation Criteria

The evaluation will be based on the lowest price. Trade agreements and regions of opportunity are as follows:

* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* Regions of Opportunity: None
* Regions of Delivery: British Columbia

#### Submission Information

Prospective bidders can view the tender announcement and submission details on the [Ariba Discovery Website](https://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/19379672?extsite=MTkzNzk2NzJfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==).

Contact information for this tender is:
- Name: Mike Sole (SPAC/PSPC)
- Email: [mike.sole@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:mike.sole@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca) - Phone: None
- Fax: None
- Address: None

#### Schedule

The tender closing date is May 3, 2024, 14:00:00. The expected tue contract start date is April 25, 2024. The expected contract end date is not specified. 

Please follow your institution's communication guidelines if you contact me with any inquiries
